Text:
I've found a way to blaze a trail to the legendary temple of Atzoatl. A spell cast upon these ancient waystones, triggered by the blood of the Vaal. I've got some in me, you see. This spell will take you into days past. Once there, keep the portal open by slitting a few deserving throats. The longer you stay, the more I learn about the location of the present day temple. 

Once we find it, we'll have all the time in the world to collect its many treasures. That's why we need to find the temple in the here
Good to see you survived your first Incursion.

Listen, these blood spells are fickle things. They must be performed under certain conditions - days of the week, stars aligned... that sort of thing. I'll scout out a new location to perform the next ritual. Find me and we'll continue our venture!
I knew you'd find me. You and I, we're two coins in the same purse. Your last foray got us a little closer to finding the temple, but we have a ways to go. Hope you're ready for another!
Look familiar? This is the temple as you left it last time. Every new Incursion changes this map of mine. With enough under our belt, perhaps the Temple's current location will be revealed!
Ah there you are. Ready to revisit the past? The more you kill, the more you change my map, and the closer we get to finding the Temple in the present day.
Here's the plan.
Let's have a look at the layout.
Every Incursion needs proper preparations.
Have a look at where you're going.
Good job.
Good job, exile.
The temple looms closer with each new step! Find me again and we'll continue our task.
The location of the Temple is now clear. Make sure you've got enough supplies. Let me know when you're ready, and we can go. I'll open another portal to get us there.

I did it! I mean, we did it. The location of the Temple is now clear! Remember to watch your step, exile. We may have helped build this layout, but a lot can change in two thousand years. There's no telling what kind of things have taken up residence in those ruins...
Hope you've made some bag space. Today we make off with a king's ransom!
The Architect of Iron has established a smithing setup in that room. Take care you don't run afoul of their metal carapaces.
Atmohua's got himself a very nice armoury thanks to you, and everyone else is sure to benefit from his protection.
You've paved the way for a heavily armoured defensive force to take up residence. I'm not exactly sure why you'd want that, but maybe we can sell the armour for scrap.
You've decided to keep the Architect of the Breach alive. I... honestly don't know what he'll do in that room.
Whatever Zilquapa found in that room, you're letting him keep it? Bit of a risk, but no risk, no reward.
Great, Zilquapa's madness has given eldritch... <italic>{things}... ingress to the temple. Was that your intention, or should I applaud you for your foolhardiness?
Wise idea, handing the room over to this architect. More blood to shed means more time in the great temple. Behold! The spoils of war!
Without a rival, Cholotl's sure to step up his recruitment efforts. Not a problem for you, I'm sure.
You've let Cholotl turn that chamber into a sanctuary for the most war-mad Vaal out there. I hope this doesn't come back to bite us.
Now the Architect of Expansion has a base of operations from which to begin exploring Wraeclast.
With Uromoti's rival dead, his resources will be put to good use, furthering the Vaal's prodigious exploration efforts.
Uromoti's exploration is on a scale like I've never seen. What are they looking for? What could <italic>{possibly} be left to explore?
You've made space for the Architect of the Hoard to keep his "finds".
Juatalotli's got a lot more room to store his strange collection with his rival out of the way.
With another rival dead, the Architect of the Hoard's going to fill that room with all sorts of valuables. Good thinking.
The Architect of Corruption has claimed that room for his nefarious experiments.
Paquate's used his growing influence to funnel more corrupting energies into that room.
The influence of his corruption continues to build. But you already knew that, right?
The Architect of the Vault has taken that room? This is <italic>{excellent} news!
Since you've killed his rival, we can probably bank on Estazunti stashing even more delectable wealth in that room.
Shall we make a bet exile? I bet Estazunti has flooded that room with finery and treasure by this point. An exciting thought isn't it?
Because of your actions, and shadowed by those... creeping experiments, Citaqualotl, Architect of the Swarm now resides.
With all fear removed, Citaqualotl seems to have turned his tinkering to moving devices of strange metals.
So the crazed scientist thought to combine both metal and insect? Hopefully they're long gone by the time we come back.
In that chamber, the Architect of the Forge now hammers away in sparks and steam.
Puhuarte's hammer will continue to echo through the dark, I trust you have a reason for this?
Your actions have allowed Puhuarte's imaginings to run free. What kinds of horrible devices were forged here within the flames?
That room now radiates with energy, Xopec, the Architect of Power has taken it.
Xopec's experiments into electrical lifebloods came to crescendo in that room.
The powers you've let grow in Xopec, I wonder, how will they grow into the present?
Ah, giving that room to Quipolatl - an interesting choice. Must you always seek out a challenge, exile?
Quipolatl has a mind for the nexus, and with this action of yours, that mind continues to grow.
Gods, exile! You really want to make things difficult for us! Who knows what this part of the temple will be like in the future?
Hayoxi just wants to make things go <italic>{boom!} Instating them in that room... could be helpful to us.
Anyone would think you harbour the same lust for chaos as Hayoxi. Well, setting them up like this only increases their explosive arsenal.
At this rate, the mad bastard will have rigged the whole temple to blow.
Zalatl will surely reward us, if inadvertently, for placing them in control of that room.
Both you and the Architect of Thaumaturgy share a love for gems, I see.
They should call that room Zalatl's jewellery box! Imagine what their value will be today!
Such beautiful streams run through that room. It will be a shame to see Guatelitzi sully them, but all for the greater good, I suppose.
What a lovely room of drowning... Ah, the Vaal and their charm... Still, having the Architect of Flesh here shall prove interesting in the future.
Guatelitzi has really made those pools his home. Let's hope this plays out well in the present day.
Ugh, the Architect of Toxins - not my first choice to let thrive in this part of the temple...
Sounds like Tacati's plants are growing out of control. I hope to the gods you know what you're doing...
You've freed Tacati of opposition. Now he's free to fiddle with all his nasty poisons. All I'm saying is, this better not make me ill.
The Royal Architect has claimed that room for his Queen.
Xipocado seems fixated on making that room some sort of regal chamber, and you've just made it easier for him.
Want to guess whose buttocks will grace the Throne Room you've let the Royal Architect establish?
You've... let the Architect of Ceremonies, the man who led <italic>{countless} human sacrifices, take that chamber?
Ahuana's rival is dead, and now he's funnelling resources to even bloodier sacrifices in honour of his false gods and his silly Queen.
The blood of Ahuana's sacrifices is on your hands, Exile. And now there will be a lot of them.
A tempestuous character, Topotante. By all accounts. But if you want them in that room, who am I to disagree?
The winds of change billow through that room. The Architect of Storms will happily build on your fury.
The storm of the millennium was it? Let's hope it doesn't ruin anything for us in the future.
You've gone and let the Architect of Fortifications take that chamber. You know what fortifications are, don't you? We're literally planning on <italic>{raiding} that temple.
You've slain Matatl's rival. That's going to give him the resources he needs to fill the temple with traps. Traps we'll then need to avoid.
You've allowed Matatl to live, and as thanks he's put traps everywhere. I'm not entirely sure you've thought this through...
The Architect of the Guild was a notoriously talented jeweller. With him around, Atzoatl is sure to glitter.
Azcapa's rival is dead? I can hear the jewels raining down from here. I cannot wait to find this temple!
Azcapa yet lives? Exile, you're going to make me a <italic>{very} happy woman. Happy and rich.
Ticaba did love his gladiator battles. Historical records aside, I suppose allowing him to live might make weapons easier to come by.
No better place to spill Vaal blood than in the arena. And no better architect to leave in control there than Ticaba.
So you left Ticaba to reminisce in the shadow of his arena champions... Hopefully eternity will reward your actions.
Jiquani was obsessed with finding new and creative ways to get things done. Keeping him in there will surely result in a reward, right?
Jiquani doesn't get his title for nothing I see. He's been very "industrious" in keeping himself alive and in business.
I have to say exile, I'm desperate to see what your plan was in keeping this bastard breathing. I guess we'll see soon enough.
You've forged some new connections!
Oh, you've opened new paths!
You've made getting around the temple easier!
The paths you've opened will help us later.
Hmm... No luck this time I'm afraid. Nothing's changed on the map. Not a bad thing... perhaps not a good thing either? Keep trying.
Nope! Nothing changed this time. Keep trying. The more you change, the more we know.
Hmm, no change. Hope that's what you wanted!
Zantipi was my kind of architect! He was fixated on filling chests with valuables then rigging them with all sorts of traps.
With Zantipi's growing influence, there are certain to be even more dangerous -- and lucrative -- chests around.
A whole room filled with dangerous strongboxes packed to the brim with treasure. You're my favourite person, Exile.
Tzamoto had a twisted sense of justice. Executions were saved for the particularly brutal crimes... He'd just imprison lower criminals for the rest of their lives.
I suppose you have your reasons for wanting Tzamoto's prison to grow, but I can't for the life of me see why.
Tzamoto's prison is enormous and brimming with criminals. Notoriously poor criminals. Wonderful. Thanks for that, Exile.
Opiloti took that room? He was a brutally violent warlord. I hope you know what you're doing, for my sake!
The Vaal were considered peaceful by today's standards, but there were still people who took joy in violence. And you just gave one of those people exactly what he wanted.
Opiloti used to spill the blood of his greatest warriors. He believed it would grant them immortality. I guess we'll soon see if he was right!
